intro: Seseli libanotis subsp. sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian angel's trumpets, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
